articles.headline: Want It or Not, TV Goes 3-D
articles.snippet: At the Consumer Electronics Show, some companies proclaim the coming of 3-D television whether you want it or not.
articles.abstract: At the Consumer Electronics Show, some companies proclaim the coming of 3-D television whether you want it or not.
articles.lead_paragraph: At the end of each season of “The Amazing Race,” the host always says something like: “Five continents, 14 countries, 21 days, 25,000 miles. You are the official winners of ‘The Amazing Race!’ ”

articles.headline: Agony Sets In as Medics Focus on the Survivors
articles.snippet: Victims suffered inside a medical compound, while outside other injured people waited beside the bodies of the dead.
articles.abstract: Victims suffered inside a medical compound, while outside other injured people waited beside the bodies of the dead.
articles.lead_paragraph: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti — “I just want my wife’s corpse,” said Lionnel Dervil, pleading in vain to bury his wife in his home province.

articles.headline: Baidu’s Gain from Departure Could Be China’s Loss
articles.snippet: Some analysts say a lack of strong competition could slow the overall development of the Internet in China.
articles.abstract: Some analysts say a lack of strong competition could slow the overall development of the Internet in China.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI  If Google pulls out of China because of concerns over government controls, this country could be left with just one major Internet search engine: Baidu.com.

articles.headline: Proposals Clash on States’ Role in Health Plans
articles.snippet: The House legislation calls for a national marketplace for health care plans. Senators would rather let the states oversee 50 separate exchanges.
articles.abstract: The House legislation calls for a national marketplace for health care plans. Senators would rather let the states oversee 50 separate exchanges.
articles.lead_paragraph: Should someone in Idaho or Nevada have significantly different health care coverage from someone in Massachusetts?

articles.headline: Democrats Fight to Hold Crucial Seat: Kennedy’s
articles.snippet: Operatives are scrambling to help Martha Coakley’s Senate campaign as the state is bombarded with ads.
articles.abstract: Operatives are scrambling to help Martha Coakley’s Senate campaign as the state is bombarded with ads.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOSTON  Martha Coakley stepped briskly through a community center here Tuesday, issuing clipped greetings and appealing for votes in a race she was once thought to have sewn up. Always a bit stiff, she laughed politely when one man shouted his support, murmuring, “We all need to make some noise right now.”

articles.headline: Wall St. Ethos Under Scrutiny at Hearing
articles.snippet: An exchange at a financial hearing in Washington laid bare a truth about Wall Street: if there’s a buyer, no matter how sophisticated, there’s a seller.
articles.abstract: An exchange at a financial hearing in Washington laid bare a truth about Wall Street: if there’s a buyer, no matter how sophisticated, there’s a seller.
articles.lead_paragraph: The 10 members of the panel, brows furrowed and some furiously taking notes, squared off against the Wall Street chiefs in Washington over the billions in bonuses, and who was really to blame for bringing the financial system to its knees.

articles.headline: In Rebuke of China, Focus Falls on Cybersecurity
articles.snippet: Google’s threat to end its operations in China brought attention to reports of Chinese high-technology espionage.
articles.abstract: Google’s threat to end its operations in China brought attention to reports of Chinese high-technology espionage.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Even before Google threatened to pull out of China in response to an attack on its computer systems, the company was notifying activists whose e-mail accounts might have been compromised by hackers.
articles.byline: By Miguel Helft and John Markoff

articles.headline: Google Is Not Alone in Discontent, but Its Threat to Leave Stands Out
articles.snippet: The company’s move reflects a deeper shift in longstanding unease among executives doing business in China.
articles.abstract: The company’s move reflects a deeper shift in longstanding unease among executives doing business in China.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Google is far from alone among Western companies in its growing unhappiness with Chinese government policies, although it is highly unusual in threatening to pull out of the country entirely in protest.
articles.byline: By Keith Bradsher and David Barboza

articles.headline: Forget Wind. Pickens Turns Focus to Gas.
articles.snippet: The Texas billionaire has tried to get Americans to embrace new sources of energy. His new advertising campaign might stir controversy.
articles.abstract: The Texas billionaire has tried to get Americans to embrace new sources of energy. His new advertising campaign might stir controversy.
articles.lead_paragraph: DALLAS  Arabic script is about to appear on television sets across the country, with the Texas oilman T. Boone Pickens helpfully reading an English translation.

articles.headline: Few Burns for Four Bankers on the Hot Seat
articles.snippet: The Wall Street bankers were humiliated, fidgety and somewhat contrite in a hearing held by the commission established to examine the causes of the financial crisis.
articles.abstract: The Wall Street bankers were humiliated, fidgety and somewhat contrite in a hearing held by the commission established to examine the causes of the financial crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The four bankers of the apocalypse strode into the Congressional hearing room and formed a crooked line. They raised their hands haltingly, looking at one another as if to see whether the other guys were going to do it, too. It was one of the more indecisive swearings-in you will ever see on Capitol Hill.

articles.headline: Tensions Mount in Devastated Capital as Nations Step Up Aid Pledges to Haiti
articles.snippet: Signs of tension and urgency were growing in the devastated capital as the police and government had all but vanished.
articles.abstract: Signs of tension and urgency were growing in the devastated capital as the police and government had all but vanished.
articles.lead_paragraph: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti  The distance between life and death narrowed in this flattened city on Thursday, with survival two days after the huge earthquake struck depending increasingly on the luck of being freed from under rubble, on treating the thousands of wounded and on speeding the halting flow of emergency food and water.

articles.headline: Taxing Banks for the Bailout
articles.snippet: President Obama said he wanted the tax on big financial institutions to “recover every single dime” for taxpayers.
articles.abstract: President Obama said he wanted the tax on big financial institutions to “recover every single dime” for taxpayers.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  President Obama laid down his proposal for a new tax on the nation’s largest financial institutions on Thursday, saying he wanted “to recover every single dime the American people are owed” for bailing out the economy.
